Key Match Events: Ferran Torres scored the only goal of the match in the first half, securing a 1-0 victory for Spain.
David Raya made a crucial save to deny Armando Broja from scoring.
Kristjan Asllani had a well-struck shot saved by David Raya just before half-time.
Robin Le Normand took out Armando Broja as he threatened to race through.
Pre-Game Insights: Sylvinho acknowledged that Albania was in a tough group with Italy, Croatia, and Spain, and they knew advancing to the second round was unlikely.
Sylvinho mentioned that even Spain's B team could play the final and still be favorites.
Post-Match Reflections: Albania displayed pride and determination despite the loss, competing fiercely against Spain.
The Albanian team and fans left the match proud of their performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Albania is noted as the most international team in the competition with players born in nine different countries.
Spain's starting lineup included only one player, Aymeric Laporte, who had started a previous game in the tournament.
